Package proyectocalcu

Class ArbolBinarioExp

java.lang.Object
proyectocalcu.ArbolBinarioExp
public class ArbolBinarioExp extends Object
The ArbolBinarioExp class represents a binary expression tree used for evaluating mathematical expressions. It allows the creation of expression trees from string expressions and their evaluation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ArbolBinarioExp()
    Default constructor for the ArbolBinarioExp class.
    ArbolBinarioExp(String cadena)
    Constructor for the ArbolBinarioExp class that creates an expression tree from a given string expression.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArbolBinarioExp

      public ArbolBinarioExp()
      Default constructor for the ArbolBinarioExp class. Initializes the root node to null.

    • ArbolBinarioExp

      public ArbolBinarioExp(String cadena)
      Constructor for the ArbolBinarioExp class that creates an expression tree from a given string expression.
      Parameters:
      cadena - The string expression to be converted into an expression tree.

  • Method Details

    • reiniciarArbol

      public void reiniciarArbol()
      Resets the expression tree by setting the root node to null.

    • creaNodo

      public void creaNodo(Object dato)
      Creates a new root node with the given data.
      Parameters:
      dato - The data for the new root node.

    • creaSubArbol

      public NodoArbol creaSubArbol(NodoArbol dato2, NodoArbol dato1, NodoArbol operador)
      Creates a subtree with the given data and left and right children.
      Parameters:
      dato2 - The data for the new root node.
      dato1 - The left child of the root node.
      operador - The right child of the root node.
      Returns:
      The root node of the created subtree.

    • arbolVacio

      public boolean arbolVacio()
      Checks if the expression tree is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the tree is empty, false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString(int a)
      Returns a string representation of the expression tree in pre-order, in-order, or post-order format.
      Parameters:
      a - The order in which to traverse the tree (0 for pre-order, 1 for in-order, 2 for post-order).
      Returns:
      The string representation of the expression tree in the specified order.

    • EvaluaExpresion

      public double EvaluaExpresion()
      Evaluates the expression tree and returns the result as a double.
      Returns:
      The result of the expression evaluation.
